fields.Video Description: This video was recorded by Maxime Rioux in Ljubljana, Slovenia. French is spoken by as many as 274 million people, primarily in the Western European nations of France, Switzerland, and Belgium, the North American territories of Qu√©bec, New Brunswick, and Louisiana, and French Guiana in South America. It is also an important lingua franca throughout West Africa and parts of the Caribbean. Maxime‚Äôs native variety of Qu√©becois French, sometimes known simply as Qu√©becois, is spoken by about seven million people, primarily in the Canadian province of Qu√©bec. Like other varieties of North American French, such as Acadian and Louisiana French, Qu√©becois has diverged considerably from European varieties, retaining 18th-century pronunciations and incorporating loanwords from English. Politically and in education, Canadian French varieties have enjoyed considerable protection since 1969, when the Canadian government recognized French alongside English at the country‚Äôs federal level.

Demographics: 60,000,000 in France (ELDIA 2012). Population total all countries: 74,980,460.
